Despite the massacre, Itachi deeply loved his brother and always intended for him to grow strong enough to defeat him, believing it would help Sasuke redeem the Uchiha name. This complicated dynamic between the brothers adds a layer of depth and emotion to Itachi's story.
Itachi is also known for his philosophical nature. He often engaged in deep and thought-provoking dialogues, questioning the nature of reality, truth, and the choices individuals make. His wisdom and introspective personality made him a character who could see beyond the surface and understand the complexities of the world around him.
Even after his death, Itachi's influence on the series remains profound. His actions, motives, and the revelations about his true intentions continue to impact the storyline and other characters. Itachi Uchiha's legacy is one of heroism, tragedy, and profound wisdom, making him one of the most beloved and memorable characters in the Naruto series."
